result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie Texca Perez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephanie Texca Perez in court.  Attorney Michael Reyes in court for Stephanie Texca Perez.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed the letter of the apology and the essay. Defendant has completed 4 hours of the community service. Defendant needs to complete the community service hours in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Progress Report 9.16.22.pdf

Defendant Stephanie Texca Perez in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stephanie Texca Perez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.

Upon motion of the Defense, Court modified no contact order to the following: Defendant is allowed to attend her graduation rehersal and ceremony on 6/10/22 and 6/11/22 in which individuals she has been ordered to have no contact with will be in attendance. While attending her graduation rehersal and ceremony she is ordered to remain 100 feet away from GF, DG, and SG. While at the graduation rehersal and ceremony she is to not speak to, text, or attempt to reach GF, DG, and SG in any way. State to submit a revised no contact order. 
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case set today for a DPA Hearing. Due to the Court bring in trial, case was rescheduled. Parties were notified of the next court date via email.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephanie Texca Perez in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stephanie Texca Perez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in Court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. Due to court congestion, Court adjourns case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30. Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing is scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00am.

Defendant Stephanie Texca Perez in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stephanie Texca Perez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gabriela O.F., Devonte J.G. and Sariah M.G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stephanie Texca Perez in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 028198,
Payable Number: 994521,
Receipt Number: 22RP011777,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/22  @ 2:30p
